item.description: Non-decreasing Array Given an array with $n$ integers, your task is to check if it could become non-decreasing by modifying at most 1 element. We define an array is non-decreasing if array[i] <= array[i + 1] holds for every i (1 <= i < n). 思路: 使用for loop扫描数列,假如在下标idx, idx+1处不满足非递减关系,那么: 要么 array[idx-1]<=array[idx+1],此时只要判断idx+1后都满足非递减关系即可 要么array[idx-1]>array[idx+1],此时只要用array[idx]代替array[idx+1],再判断idx+1后都满足非递减关系即可 class Solution: def checkPossibility(self, nums): """ :type nums: List[int] :rtype: bool """ idx = 0 for i in range(len(nums)-1): if nums[i] > nums[i+1]: idx = i break if idx > 0 and (nums[idx-1] > nums[idx+1]): nums[idx+1] = nums[idx] for j in range(idx+1, len(nums)-1): if nums[j] > nums[j+1]: return False else: return True Leetcode运行结果:

item.title: TwoSum in Python
item.description: 方式一：Brute Force class Solution: def twoSum(self, nums, target): for idx1, element in enumerate(nums): try: idx2 = nums[idx1 + 1:].index(target - element) + idx1 + 1 except ValueError: continue return [idx1, idx2] return None Time complexity: $O(n^2)$ Space complexity: $O(1)$ Leetcode Submission Detail: Runtime: 1629 ms Beats 17.69% of python3 submissions 方式二：One-pass Hash Table class Solution: def twoSum(self, nums, target): numDict = {} for idx1, element in enumerate(nums): try: idx2 = numDict[target - element] except KeyError: numDict[element] = idx1 continue return [idx1, idx2] return None Time complexity: $O(n)$ Space complexity: $O(n)$ Leetcode Submission Detail: Runtime: 61 ms Beats 73.
